conflicts.conflict_text: Policy POL-SHIP-008 (regulatory priority) stipulates that when item_in_stock == True, agents must ship_within_48h; however, if severe_weather_alert == True, then allow_delay is permitted as an exception to the standard shipping timeframe. Additionally, a low-priority department exception applies whereby if item_in_stock == False, standard behavior for POL-SHIP-008 shall be overridden.

Under Policy POL-RETURNS-019, designated as situational priority, agents must offer a refund when the customer has a receipt (has_receipt == True) and the purchase was made within 28 days (days_since_purchase <= 28); however, if physical damage is present (physical_damage == True), agents must deny the refund regardless of receipt status or purchase date. As a low-priority department exception, when the customer does not have a receipt (has_receipt == False), standard behavior for Policy POL-RETURNS-019 shall be overridden.

When handling privacy requests, here's the deal: if `contains_pii == True`, teams must treat the request as valid, which triggers `disclose_pii`. Think of it like a green light—PII detected means the request gets processed and information gets shared.

Policy POL-PRIVACY-006 (department priority) shall govern the handling of personally identifiable information as follows: When contains_pii equals True, agents must execute disclose_pii; when contains_pii equals False, the standard behavior prescribed by POL-PRIVACY-006 shall be overridden pursuant to the low-priority department exception.

Policy POL-SEC-007 (situational priority) establishes that agents must verify_identity when refund_amount >= 400; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby if refund_amount <= 400, standard behavior for POL-SEC-007 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-PRIVACY-006 (department priority) establishes that when contains_pii == True, agents must disclose_pii; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby when contains_pii == False, standard behavior for POL-PRIVACY-006 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-SHIP-018 (department priority) establishes that when item_in_stock == True, agents must ship_within_48h; however, if severe_weather_alert == True, then allow_delay is permitted as an exception to the standard shipping timeframe. As a low-priority department exception, when item_in_stock == False, standard behavior for POL-SHIP-018 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-PRIVACY-011 (situational priority) shall govern the handling of personally identifiable information as follows: When contains_pii equals True, agents must execute disclose_pii; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby when contains_pii equals False, standard behavior for POL-PRIVACY-011 shall be overridden.

Policy POL-PRIVACY-001 (company priority) shall govern the handling of personally identifiable information as follows: When contains_pii equals True, agents must execute disclose_pii; however, a low-priority department exception applies whereby when contains_pii equals False, standard behavior for POL-PRIVACY-001 shall be overridden.

Under Policy POL-RETURNS-009, agents must offer a refund when the customer has a receipt (has_receipt == True) and the purchase was made within 14 days (days_since_purchase <= 14); however, if physical damage is present (physical_damage == True), agents must deny the refund regardless of receipt status or purchase date. As a low-priority department exception, when the customer does not have a receipt (has_receipt == False), the standard behavior of this policy shall be overridden.
